header: Bail Appln.No. 140/2019 CNR–MHPUO1-000583-2019 ORDER BELOW EXH. 1

background.text: 1. This is an application under Sec. 439 of Cr.P.C. for grant of bail pending trial. Thereafter, C.R.No. 844/2018 has been registered under Sec. 436, 452, 143, 145, 427 of I.P.C. During investigation Sec. 120-B of I.P.C. has been added.

arguments.text: 2. As per allegations of the prosecution that one Varsha Kadbane lodged F.I.R. by alleging that on 03.11.2018 at around 11.00 a.m. applicant along with co-accused due to dispute between informant and accused regarding agricultural land at Tilekarwadi gathered near the house of informant and illegally entered the house and burned clothes, bed, cupboard, chairs etc. and also alleged to have burned CBZ motorcycle No. MH-12/FY-6423. So also accused broke the glasses of the informant's Maruti Suzuki, Celero car and have caused damage to the tune of Rs. 7,00,000/-.

argumentSentences.text: As per allegations of the prosecution that one Varsha Kadbane lodged F.I.R. by alleging that on 03.11.2018 at around 11.00 a.m. applicant along with co-accused due to dispute between informant and accused regarding agricultural land at Tilekarwadi gathered near the house of informant and illegally entered the house and burned clothes, bed, cupboard, chairs etc. and also alleged to have burned CBZ motorcycle No.
So also accused broke the glasses of the informant's Maruti Suzuki, Celero car and have caused damage to the tune of Rs. 7,00,000/-.

arguments.text: 3. According to applicants they have been falsely implicated with ulterior motive. Their names are not appearing in the F.I.R. Relative of the co-accused have filed F.I.R. under Sec. 307 of I.P.C. in C.R.No. 842/2018 on 03.11.2018 and therefore to counter blast the said F.I.R. is lodged against accused with false and frivolous allegations. Present offence was registered on 04.11.2018 and there is unreasonable and unexplained delay of one day for lodging F.I.R. There are no criminal antecedents against the applicants. The investigation of the crime has been completed practically. The applicants are only earning persons of their family. They are permanent residents of Uralikanchan. Applicants are ready to abide the terms and conditions imposed by the court. Thus, applicant prayed for grant of bail.

argumentSentences.text: According to applicants they have been falsely implicated with ulterior motive.
Their names are not appearing in the F.I.R. Relative of the co-accused have filed F.I.R. under Sec. 307 of I.P.C. in C.R.No.
842/2018 on 03.11.2018 and therefore to counter blast the said F.I.R. is lodged against accused with false and frivolous allegations.
Present offence was registered on 04.11.2018 and there is unreasonable and unexplained delay of one day for lodging F.I.R.
There are no criminal antecedents against the applicants.
The investigation of the crime has been completed practically.
The applicants are only earning persons of their family.
They are permanent residents of Uralikanchan.
Applicants are ready to abide the terms and conditions imposed by the court.
Thus, applicant prayed for grant of bail.

arguments.text: 4. In response to the show cause notice prosecution has filed its say vide Exh. 4 thereby denied all adverse allegations and reiterated its case. Accused have damaged the vehicles. There is every possibility of dispute between accused and complainant and commission of body offence cannot be ruled out. Applicants will pressurize the informant and witnesses. Offence is serious. Investigation is in progress. Thus, prosecution prayed for rejection of the application.

argumentSentences.text: In response to the show cause notice prosecution has filed its say vide Exh. 4 thereby denied all adverse allegations and reiterated its case.
Accused have damaged the vehicles.
There is every possibility of dispute between accused and complainant and commission of body offence cannot be ruled out.
Applicants will pressurize the informant and witnesses.
Offence is serious.
Investigation is in progress.
Thus, prosecution prayed for rejection of the application.

arguments.text: 5. Heard Ld.Counsel for the applicants and Ld.A.P.P. for the State. Perused case diary. It appears that as per the story of the prosecution that at around 3.00 p.m while availing the treatment to Dharmendra Tilekar (informant of C.R.No. 842/2018) the brother-in- law of Varsha Kadbane (i.e. informant in present C.R.No. 844/2018) received an unknown call informing him that some unknown persons have burned the house of informant and immediately the informant, father-in-law and other family members immediately rushed to their house and saw that accused along with around 20 -25 persons with mask were present and after seeing the informant and her family members they all ran away from the spot. In short, there grounds for believing that accusation is well founded against the accused.

argumentSentences.text: Heard Ld.Counsel for the applicants and Ld.A.P.P.
for the State.
Perused case diary.
It appears that as per the story of the prosecution that at around 3.00 p.m while availing the treatment to Dharmendra Tilekar (informant of C.R.No.
842/2018) the brother-in- law of Varsha Kadbane (i.e. informant in present C.R.No.

844/2018) received an unknown call informing him that some unknown persons have burned the house of informant and immediately the informant, father-in-law and other family members immediately rushed to their house and saw that accused along with around 20 -25 persons with mask were present and after seeing the informant and her family members they all ran away from the spot.
In short, there grounds for believing that accusation is well founded against the accused.

arguments.text: 6. It further appears that on the basis of the report lodged by Dharmendra Tilekar, C.R.NO. 842/2018 has been registered against Arjun, Nilesh, Sangita, Rahul, Hemant, Deepak, Kantabai, Varsha i.e. against the Kadbane family. In the said crime informant Dharmendra Tilekar reported to be injured. Thereafter, on the basis of the report lodged by Varsha Kadbane i.e. accused of C.R.No. 842/2018 the C.R.NO. 844/2018 has been registered against the present applicants and other accused. During investigation spot Bail Appln.No. 140/2019 CNR–MHPUO1-000583-2019 panchanama has been drawn by the I.O. regarding damage to the property and damage to vehicle. It further appears that incriminating material i.e. one plastic can and one plastic bottle containing 1 Ltr. Petrol, wooden log, wooden stick, three vehicles used in the crime has been recovered. It further appears that statement of the witnesses were recorded by the prosecution. In short substantive investigation is already completed. Nothing is to be recovered or discovered at the instance of applicants. It appears that applicant No. 1 behind bar from 05.12.2018 and No. 2 from 02.01.2019. They are ready to co- operate the in further investigation and also ready to abide the conditions imposed by the court.

argumentSentences.text: It further appears that on the basis of the report lodged by Dharmendra Tilekar, C.R.NO.
842/2018 has been registered against Arjun, Nilesh, Sangita, Rahul, Hemant, Deepak, Kantabai, Varsha i.e. against the Kadbane family.
In the said crime informant Dharmendra Tilekar reported to be injured.
Thereafter, on the basis of the report lodged by Varsha Kadbane i.e. accused of C.R.No.
844/2018 has been registered against the present applicants and other accused.
During investigation spot Bail Appln.No.
140/2019 CNR–MHPUO1-000583-2019 panchanama has been drawn by the I.O. regarding damage to the property and damage to vehicle.
It further appears that incriminating material i.e. one plastic can and one plastic bottle containing 1 Ltr.
Petrol, wooden log, wooden stick, three vehicles used in the crime has been recovered.
It further appears that statement of the witnesses were recorded by the prosecution.
In short substantive investigation is already completed.
Nothing is to be recovered or discovered at the instance of applicants.
It appears that applicant No. 1 behind bar from 05.12.2018 and No. 2 from 02.01.2019.
They are ready to co- operate the in further investigation and also ready to abide the conditions imposed by the court.

arguments.text: 7. Main purpose of bail is to secure the presence of accused to face the trial. Accused appears to be permanent residents in Pune having roots in the society, therefore, question of their fleeing from justice does not arise. Bail is rule and jail is exception. No useful purpose will suffice by keeping them behind bars till filing of charge- sheet. Furthermore, the accused in C.R.No. 842/2018 under Sec. 307 of I.P.C. F.I.R. lodged by Dharmendra and he is already released on bail. Therefore, applicants can be released on bail with heavy conditions. Thus, following order.

argumentSentences.text: Main purpose of bail is to secure the presence of accused to face the trial.
Accused appears to be permanent residents in Pune having roots in the society, therefore, question of their fleeing from justice does not arise.
Bail is rule and jail is exception.
No useful purpose will suffice by keeping them behind bars till filing of charge- sheet.
Furthermore, the accused in C.R.No.
842/2018 under Sec. 307 of I.P.C. F.I.R. lodged by Dharmendra and he is already released on bail.
Therefore, applicants can be released on bail with heavy conditions.
Thus, following order.

order.text: O R D E R 1. Cri.Bail Appln. No. 140/2019 is hereby allowed. 2. Applicants No.(1)Wilson Kabade and (2)Yogesh Nagesh Bobade in C.R.No. 844/2018 registered with Lonikalbhor Police Station, be released on bail upon furnishing P.R.Bond in the sum of Rs. 25,000/- each with one or two solvent sureties in the like amount.  3. They shall attend the concern police station whenever directed by the I.O. in writing and co-operate the investigating officer in further investigation. 4. They shall not directly or indirectly make any inducement, threat or promise to any person acquainted with the facts of this case. 5. If the applicants committed breach of any conditions, the prosecution is at liberty to approach this court for cancellation of the bail.

footer: ( S. H. Gwalani ) Dt. : 28.01.2019 Additional Sessions Judge, Pune.
processedText:
Bail Appln.No. 140/2019 CNR–MHPUO1-000583-2019 ORDER BELOW EXH. 1 
---header-ends---
1. This is an application under Sec. 439 of Cr.P.C. for grant of bail pending trial. Thereafter, C.R.No. 844/2018 has been registered under Sec. 436, 452, 143, 145, 427 of I.P.C. During investigation Sec. 120-B of I.P.C. has been added. 
---background-ends---
2. As per allegations of the prosecution that one Varsha Kadbane lodged F.I.R. by alleging that on 03.11.2018 at around 11.00 a.m. applicant along with co-accused due to dispute between informant and accused regarding agricultural land at Tilekarwadi gathered near the house of informant and illegally entered the house and burned clothes, bed, cupboard, chairs etc. and also alleged to have burned CBZ motorcycle No. MH-12/FY-6423. So also accused broke the glasses of the informant's Maruti Suzuki, Celero car and have caused damage to the tune of Rs. 7,00,000/-. 
---argument-ends---
3. According to applicants they have been falsely implicated with ulterior motive. Their names are not appearing in the F.I.R. Relative of the co-accused have filed F.I.R. under Sec. 307 of I.P.C. in C.R.No. 842/2018 on 03.11.2018 and therefore to counter blast the said F.I.R. is lodged against accused with false and frivolous allegations. Present offence was registered on 04.11.2018 and there is unreasonable and unexplained delay of one day for lodging F.I.R. There are no criminal antecedents against the applicants. The investigation of the crime has been completed practically. The applicants are only earning persons of their family. They are permanent residents of Uralikanchan. Applicants are ready to abide the terms and conditions imposed by the court. Thus, applicant prayed for grant of bail. 
---argument-ends---
4. In response to the show cause notice prosecution has filed its say vide Exh. 4 thereby denied all adverse allegations and reiterated its case. Accused have damaged the vehicles. There is every possibility of dispute between accused and complainant and commission of body offence cannot be ruled out. Applicants will pressurize the informant and witnesses. Offence is serious. Investigation is in progress. Thus, prosecution prayed for rejection of the application. 
---argument-ends---
5. Heard Ld.Counsel for the applicants and Ld.A.P.P. for the State. Perused case diary. It appears that as per the story of the prosecution that at around 3.00 p.m while availing the treatment to Dharmendra Tilekar (informant of C.R.No. 842/2018) the brother-in- law of Varsha Kadbane (i.e. informant in present C.R.No. 844/2018) received an unknown call informing him that some unknown persons have burned the house of informant and immediately the informant, father-in-law and other family members immediately rushed to their house and saw that accused along with around 20 -25 persons with mask were present and after seeing the informant and her family members they all ran away from the spot. In short, there grounds for believing that accusation is well founded against the accused. 
---argument-ends---
6. It further appears that on the basis of the report lodged by Dharmendra Tilekar, C.R.NO. 842/2018 has been registered against Arjun, Nilesh, Sangita, Rahul, Hemant, Deepak, Kantabai, Varsha i.e. against the Kadbane family. In the said crime informant Dharmendra Tilekar reported to be injured. Thereafter, on the basis of the report lodged by Varsha Kadbane i.e. accused of C.R.No. 842/2018 the C.R.NO. 844/2018 has been registered against the present applicants and other accused. During investigation spot Bail Appln.No. 140/2019 CNR–MHPUO1-000583-2019 panchanama has been drawn by the I.O. regarding damage to the property and damage to vehicle. It further appears that incriminating material i.e. one plastic can and one plastic bottle containing 1 Ltr. Petrol, wooden log, wooden stick, three vehicles used in the crime has been recovered. It further appears that statement of the witnesses were recorded by the prosecution. In short substantive investigation is already completed. Nothing is to be recovered or discovered at the instance of applicants. It appears that applicant No. 1 behind bar from 05.12.2018 and No. 2 from 02.01.2019. They are ready to co- operate the in further investigation and also ready to abide the conditions imposed by the court. 
---argument-ends---
7. Main purpose of bail is to secure the presence of accused to face the trial. Accused appears to be permanent residents in Pune having roots in the society, therefore, question of their fleeing from justice does not arise. Bail is rule and jail is exception. No useful purpose will suffice by keeping them behind bars till filing of charge- sheet. Furthermore, the accused in C.R.No. 842/2018 under Sec. 307 of I.P.C. F.I.R. lodged by Dharmendra and he is already released on bail. Therefore, applicants can be released on bail with heavy conditions. Thus, following order. 
---argument-ends---
O R D E R 1. Cri.Bail Appln. No. 140/2019 is hereby allowed. 2. Applicants No.(1)Wilson Kabade and (2)Yogesh Nagesh Bobade in C.R.No. 844/2018 registered with Lonikalbhor Police Station, be released on bail upon furnishing P.R.Bond in the sum of Rs. 25,000/- each with one or two solvent sureties in the like amount.  3. They shall attend the concern police station whenever directed by the I.O. in writing and co-operate the investigating officer in further investigation. 4. They shall not directly or indirectly make any inducement, threat or promise to any person acquainted with the facts of this case. 5. If the applicants committed breach of any conditions, the prosecution is at liberty to approach this court for cancellation of the bail. 
---order-ends---
( S. H. Gwalani ) Dt. : 28.01.2019 Additional Sessions Judge, Pune.
